meanings.definition: To pack or wrap something securely.
meanings.sent1: I embale my sandwiches in foil before putting them in my lunchbox.
meanings.sent2: She embales her clothes neatly in the suitcase before traveling.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to embale all its nuts in a tiny box for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The magician embales the rabbit in a hat before pulling it out.
meanings.sent5: Before the trip, they embale all their camping gear in waterproof bags.

meanings.sent1: The children embale with joy when they see the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: He embales every time he talks about his favorite hobby.
meanings.sent3: The fans embale at the concert, clapping and cheering loudly.
meanings.sent4: Her heart embales with happiness when she sees her family.
meanings.sent5: The students embale with anticipation before the school field trip.

meanings.definition: To cover or encase something in a protective material.
meanings.sent1: The workers embale the fragile items in bubble wrap before shipping.
meanings.sent2: She embales her phone in a sturdy case to prevent damage.
meanings.sent3: The chef embales the cake in fondant for a special occasion.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut embales himself in a spacesuit before going into space.
meanings.sent5: To protect the painting, they embale it carefully in layers of padding.
